summary: Build EventX, a dark-mode mobile event management app for alternative culture events (motorcycle clubs, tattoo conventions, music festivals) with role-based experiences and all user-facing UI text in Brazilian Portuguese.
architectural_notes: All user-facing UI text (titles, buttons, labels) must be in Brazilian Portuguese; structural/logic descriptions may be in English.
Push notifications are not supported; implement notifications via internal in-app announcements (surface prominently on Home).
Support offline-capable experiences for 'Meus Ingressos' and 'Mapa' via local caching/sync when online.

existing_features.title: Implement a Brazilian-Portuguese-only UI policy across the entire frontend: every user-facing string (titles, labels, buttons, navigation, empty states, errors) must be in pt-BR, including role names and menu tabs.

Create the core app shell optimized for mobile: bottom-tab main navigation with the tabs “Início”, “Programação”, “Mapa”, “Ingressos”, “Perfil”, plus a role-aware experience (Organizador, Expositor/Artista, Participante) that controls which modules are visible and editable.
Build a consistent modern dark-mode visual system with high-contrast typography and rugged/industrial iconography, applied across all screens (colors, type scale, spacing, components).
Implement Participant dashboard features: “Meus Ingressos” ticket wallet with QR code display and backend validation flow; include a validation UI for Organizador staff to verify tickets.
Implement “Minha Agenda” with favoriting: participants can browse activities (program items) and add/remove favorites; the agenda view shows only favorited items in chronological order.

Implement “Mapa do Evento” as an interactive venue map experience that can display categorized points of interest (stages, tattoo booths, food trucks, restrooms) and allow tapping markers to see details.
Create the modular event sections and navigation entries for: “Espaço Tattoo”, “Espaço Moto”, and “Lineup e Palcos”, with content configurable per event type by Organizador.

Implement “Espaço Tattoo”: artist/exhibitor gallery with portfolios, an action button labeled “Solicitar Orçamento” that sends a quote request to the artist/exhibitor inbox, and a “Concurso de Tatuagem” voting system with near-real-time updates via polling.

Implement “Espaço Moto”: a “Rotas e Comboios” section that supports route/convoy listings with start time, meeting point, and notes, plus informational pages/cards for “Área de Camping” and “Estacionamento Seguro”.
Implement “Lineup e Palcos”: a dynamic music schedule by stage (“palco”) and time with artist detail pages and a “Me avise” reminder control that creates in-app reminders (not OS push).
Implement engagement and safety tools: “Mural da Galera” community photo wall (upload + browse) and “Avisos Importantes” announcements/emergency notices managed by Organizador.

Implement “Minha Carteira” cashless area as an internal wallet ledger: show balance, transactions, and allow Organizador to issue top-ups and record on-site spending entries (no external payment provider required).

Generate and include a set of custom static image assets consistent with the rugged/industrial dark theme, and render them in the UI (app icon + tab icons + module header art). Store assets in frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the frontend.

Update the existing profile setup/edit UI to capture the new role-specific fields and to allow selecting the Expositor/Artista role (in addition to Organizador and Participante), while keeping all UI strings in pt-BR via the existing i18n system.

Add a prominent announcements entry point on the Home screen in the form of a notification bell (or equivalent) that clearly indicates the presence of recent announcements and navigates users to the announcements section/list.

Rename the bottom navigation tab label from “Programação” to “Eventos” (pt-BR) without changing the underlying route behavior unless required, and ensure the updated label is sourced from the i18n strings.

new_feature_requests.summary: Define role-based user profiles (Organizador, Expositor/Artista, Participante) and main navigation tabs: Início, Programação, Mapa, Ingressos, Perfil (PT-BR UI).
Participant dashboard: Meus Ingressos ticket wallet with QR code validation.
Participant dashboard: Minha Agenda personalized schedule with favorites.
Participant dashboard: Mapa do Evento interactive venue map (stages, tattoo booths, food trucks, restrooms).
Modular UI: Espaço Tattoo with artist gallery/portfolios, Solicitar Orçamento, and real-time Concurso de Tatuagem voting.
Modular UI: Espaço Moto with GPS-integrated Rotas e Comboios plus Área de Camping and Estacionamento Seguro info.
Modular UI: Lineup e Palcos dynamic schedule with Me avise reminders via push notifications.
Engagement: Mural da Galera community photo wall.
Payments: Minha Carteira cashless integration area for on-site consumption.
Visual design system: modern dark mode, high-contrast outdoor typography, rugged/industrial iconography.

Backend domain model and access control: persist users, roles, events, program items, favorites, tickets, validations, map POIs, tattoo artists/portfolios, quote requests, contest entries/votes, moto routes/info, lineup items, photo wall posts, announcements, and wallet ledger; enforce role-based permissions server-side.
Extend/modify existing role-based registration/profile system: Organizador must capture CNPJ/CPF and Empresa; Expositor/Artista must include Portfolio/Social Media link (PT-BR UI for all fields).
Implement in-app announcements access point: prominent Notification Bell/Announcements entry on Home screen so attendees see updates (no real push).
Offline access: ensure 'Meus Ingressos' (QR wallet) and 'Mapa' have offline-capable behavior (cached data) for use without internet.
Update/verify bottom navigation to use tab label 'Eventos' (instead of 'Programação') while keeping PT-BR UI across all tabs.

Extend the backend UserProfile data model to support organizer and exhibitor-specific profile fields required by the existing role-based system: store CNPJ/CPF and Empresa for Organizador profiles, and store a Portfolio/Social Media URL for Expositor/Artista profiles.
